result.execSummary:
The defendant Bennie D Fleming Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Bennie D Fleming Jr is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Bennie D Fleming Jr was found guilty of Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Concur to 22CF1403, 22CF1469, 22CF2036, 11CF271, 11CF273, 11CF324 and 14CM1953. Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program. Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
Concurrent with: 22CF1403, 22CF1469, 22CF2036, 11CF271, 11CF273, 11CF324 and 14CM1953.

superMiscConds.notes: $250 DNA surcharge and court costs remitted. $92 VW surcharge to be collected by the Dept of Corrections. DOC can take 25% of any and all funds in defendant's prisoner account including but not limited to 25% of gifts, wages or other funds
Maintain full-time employment/education or combination of or be seeking same, and treatment.
Defendant shall not use/possess drug paraphernalia and/or controlled substances without a valid prescription.
DNA on file. Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bennie D Fleming Jr

records.addlTxt: of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

*** IN CUSTODY ***

1:43 PM Defendant Bennie D Fleming Jr in court with Attorney Shaun W O'Connell.  ADA Colleen Lennon in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights Signed. Def entered a plea of guilty to count 2.  Court accepted defendant's plea, found and adjudged defendant guilty. 

On Motion of the State, the Court DISM Count #1. 

Victim Rights Compliance

COUNT #2 
Court sentences DE to:
-serve 2 years  in WSP, bifurcated into:
-initial confinement: 1 year
-extended supervision:1 year
-cc to 22CF1403, 22CF1469, 22CF2036, 11CF271, 11CF273, 11CF324, and 14CM1953

Challenge Incarceration Program: Eligible
Substance Abuse Program: Eligible

CONDITIONS
-Maintain full-time employment/education or a combination of both or be seeking same and treatment
-Not use/possess drug paraphernalia and/or controlled substances without valid prescription
-DNA on file
-Any other conditions DOC may impose

COURT COSTS:
Ct #2
- All CC and DNA surcharge waived. V/W surcharge to be paid through DOC
-DOC can take 25% of any and all funds in Defendant's prisoner account including but not limited to 25% of gifts, wagers or other funds

CREDIT
-Days credit for time served:  120 days credit
-Days credit to Prison: 120 days credit

-DE advised of post-conviction rights

Abby H.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 16, 2022 at 11:00 am.
ADA Carl Jacob Lazarus appeared for the State. Attorney Shaun W. O'Connell appeared in person on behalf of Defn. Plea/Sentencing scheduled.
Defn's copy 8/16/22 STC - rts/undeliv/utf
Status conference on August 16, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Information was E-filed with the court and a copy was given to the defendant; Defendant waived reading of Information; Defendant stood mute, Court enters plea of Not Guilty; motions due in 20 days; bail continued.
Branch 2

02:51 PM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Shaun W O'Connell.  Timothy Robert Verhoff appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant advised of right to and waived Preliminary Hearing (Preliminary Hearing Waiver signed); Court accepted waiver of Preliminary Hearing and ordered case bound over.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

and returned.

02:15 PM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Shaun W O'Connell.  Lillian Rose Nelson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 22, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Def's Judgment of Bail/Bond Forfeiture returned - Not deliverable as addressed/unable to forward

11:45 AM Defendant did not appear.  Benjamin Wagner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties by Zoom. Warrant and copy of Complaint given to the Sheriff's Office to attempt to serve.
